issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: metadata for values temporary tables for INSERTs are getting replicated during bootstrap

comments.body:
GitHub user anishek opened a pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/162

    HIVE-16254 : metadata for values temporary tables for INSERT's are getting replicated

    

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

    $ git pull https://github.com/anishek/hive HIVE-16254

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

    https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/162.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

    This closes #162
    
----
commit 7746e8cac7c5b2a93f638441771fa29699732950
Author: Anishek Agarwal <anishek@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-03-20T11:02:01Z

    HIVE-16254 : metadata for values temporary tables for INSERT's are getting replicated

----
build system did not pick this one up, attaching again.

Github user anishek closed the pull request at:

    https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/162
removed the earlier patch as i think i messed up two feature changes, will resolve it and post the patch soon once again .
adding the pull request branch manually https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/165
I think missed a lot of changes again, i guess I am not thinking straight

ATTACHMENT ID: 12861775 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Ugh, failure was due to me changing a List to an Iterable when doing the backport without changing the test. The change is a good change to be consistent, but not good for a simple rebase patch. However, leaving that in for now, and fixing test as well.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
